etymologies: early 17th century. From French renversement action of reversing or inverting, result of this, manoeuvre in which the direction of an aircraft is rapidly reversed from renverser + -ment

definitions: The action of reversing or inverting something; the result of this.

notes.text: In later use not fully naturalized in English.

definitions: A manoeuvre in which the direction of the aircraft is rapidly reversed, usually consisting of a half loop followed immediately by a half roll.
